info.title: Billing Account Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the Billing Account Management specification

get.summary: Retrieves a Billing Account by Account Id
get.description: This operation retrieves a BillingAccount entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the account/MSISDN - SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

parameters.name: msisdn
parameters.description: Populate the value with 'Yes' if provided id is MSISDN

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Identifier market ID of the account

400.description:
Bad Request

If the processing is not successful, the response will include information about error code and short description of error. The error in the response will be indicative of the first occurrence of the problem seen in the flow of processing. The processing stops at the first occurrence of the error. System errors will need to be investigated by Operations team. For the error scenarios caused by incorrect data, the sender may send the request again with correct data.

The error cases listed in this section assume that the incoming request has passed schema validation. This list shows the out of the box error messages and their corresponding error codes. Once the API code gets called into Singleview low level APIs there may be additional errors, but they will appear in the same format of error code and error message. Please refer to the Singleview licensed production documentation for specific details on any additional error message. Besides, any error messages customised for Unitel will be added here in the subsequent version of the EICD, during the design grooming stage.

| S. No. | Error Code | Error Message | Purpose |
|--------|------------|---------------|---------|
| 1. | E84103 | PERESTAPI_FIELD_NOT_EXIST | To validate the field value exists in the system. | 
| 2. | E84113 | PERESTAPI_ELEMENT_MISMATCH | To validate elements passed in input are matching or not. |
| 3. | E83559 | CBAPI_FIELDS_INVALID_VALUE | To validate the passed attributes in fields parameter |
| 4. | E83562 | CBAPI_INVALID_FIELD_NAME | The parameter field name is invalid |

get.summary: Retrieves list of Billing Account entities by search criteria
get.description: This operation retrieves list of BillingAccount entity

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Optional. For retrieving billing accounts where the balance date is greater than or equal to startDate, format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss. Note: If startDate is not provided it is defaulted to MIN_DATE. If no start and endDate provided startDate is set to beginning of current day

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Optional. For retrieving billing accounts where balance date is less than or equal to the endDate, format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss. If endDate is not provided it is defaulted to MAX_DATE. If no startDate and endDate provided endDate is set to end of current day

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: To retrieve data by account id - SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: To retrieve data by account name - SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_NAME

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: To retrieve data by customer node id - SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.CUSTOMER_NODE_ID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filters results based on account type SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_TYPE_DISPLAY_NAME

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: scn
parameters.description: Oracle system change number used for data read consistency. Default to empty string if configuration item SV_MAPPING: API_CONFIGURATION1.USE_FLASHBACK is not ON

400.description:
Bad Request

If the processing is not successful, the response will include information about error code and short description of error. The error in the response will be indicative of the first occurrence of the problem seen in the flow of processing. The processing stops at the first occurrence of the error. System errors will need to be investigated by Operations team. For the error scenarios caused by incorrect data, the sender may send the request again with correct data.

The error cases listed in this section assume that the incoming request has passed schema validation. This list shows the out of the box error messages and their corresponding error codes. Once the API code gets called into Singleview low level APIs there may be additional errors, but they will appear in the same format of error code and error message. Please refer to the Singleview licensed production documentation for specific details on any additional error message. Besides, any error messages customised for Unitel will be added here in the subsequent version of the EICD, during the design grooming stage.

| S. No. | Error Code | Error Message | Purpose |
|--------|------------|---------------|---------|
| 1. | E84106 | PERESTAPI_ELEMENT_MISSING | To check mandatory element is passed or not. |
| 2. | E84108 | PERESTAPI_ENTITY_NOT_FOUND_OR_NO_ACCESS | To validate the User's access privileges and/or the record does not exists in system |
| 3. | E84103 | PERESTAPI_FIELD_NOT_EXIST | To validate the field value exists in the system. |
| 4. | E84107 | PERESTAPI_INVALID_VALUE | To validate the input value |
| 5. | E83562 | CBAPI_INVALID_FIELD_NAME | To validate the passed input parameters |
| 6. | E84105 | PERESTAPI_INVALID_VALUE_FOR_CONVERSION | To validate the date being passed in format yyyy-mm-dd"T"hh:nn:ss |
| 7. | E84100 | PERESTAPI_START_DATE_GREATER_THAN_END_DATE | To validate if start date is greater than end date |
| 8. | E84113 | PERESTAPI_ELEMENT_MISMATCH | To validate elements passed in input are matching or not. |
| 9. | E83559 | CBAPI_FIELDS_INVALID_VALUE | To validate the passed attributes in fields parameter |

accountBalance.description: Describes the list of billing account details

id.description: Unique identifier of the transferred account. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID

href.description: Reference of the transferred account - <http://<PEREST_HOSTNAME>:<PEREST_PORT>/<Account PEREST URL>/<SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID>

name.description: Name of the transferred account. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_NAME

AccountRef.description: Account reference. A account may be a party account or a financial account.

issuingJurisdiction.description: Name of the taxing jurisdiction for which taxes are exempt. SV_MAPPING: TAX_CLASS->TAX_EXEMPT RT

AccountTaxExemption.description: Proof of freedom from taxes imposed by a taxing jurisdiction

id.description: Unique identifier of the account. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID

href.description: Unique reference of the account - <http://<PEREST_HOSTNAME>:<PEREST_PORT>/<billingAccount PEREST URL>/ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID

accountType.description: Complete account type name. Example: "Prepaid (JAM)". SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_TYPE_DISPLAY_NAME

description.description: Detailed description of account. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TYPE_TRE_V.DESCRIPTION

lastModified.description: Date of last modification of the account, format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.LAST_MODIFIED

name.description: Name of the account. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_NAME

market.description: Market of the account. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_NAME

ratingType.description: Indicates whether the account follows a specific payment option such as prepaid or postpaid. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_CLASS_CODE (Account Class RT) | ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_CATEGORY_CODE (Account Category RT)

state.description: Contains the lifecycle state. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_STATUS_CODE (RT acctbal.ACCOUNT_STATUS)

accountCharacteristic.description: Characteristic name supported: CurrentBalance, UnbilledAmount, TotalInvoiceOverdue, AvailableCredit, TotalDisputed, InvoiceId, InvoiceUnbilledAmount, AccountId, AccountName, accountTypeDisplayName (truncated accountType name, e.g. "Prepaid"), AccountTypeId, AccountActionCode, AccountCurrencyId, AccountCurrency, AccountStatusCode, AccountAvailableCredit, AccountBalanceExpiryDate, AccountCancellationDate, AccountFirstUseDate, AccountRestrictionDate. Characteristic value supported: SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_BALANCE, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.UNBILLED_AMOUNT, Sum of ACCOUNT_HISTORY_TRE_V.CURRENT_DUE, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.AVAILABLE_CREDIT, (ACCOUNT_TRE_V.INVOICE_DISPUTED_AMOUNT + ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_DISPUTED_AMOUNT), ACCOUNT_TRE_V.INVOICE_ID, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.INVOICE_UNBILLED_AMOUNT, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ID, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_NAME, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_TYPE_DISPLAY_NAME, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_TYPE_ID, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_ACTION_CODE, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_CURRENCY_ID, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_STATUS_CODE, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.AVAILABLE_CREDIT, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.BALANCE_EXPIRY_DATE, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.GENERAL_1, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.FIRST_USE_DATE, ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION_DATE. Characteristic value type supported: string. Characteristic unit supported: Unit of measurement of the characteristic value

restrictionDate.description: Date of account is due to change, to a restricted mode of operation, format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION_DATE

balanceExpiryDate.description: The date and time the current balance of the account is due to expire, format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.BALANCE_EXPIRY_DATE

BillingAccount.description: An account used for billing purposes.

valueType.description: The type of the value provided.

value.description: The value of the characteristic provided as a string. The value of this attribute is depending on the corresponding name attribute value which indirectly determines the correct internal field to map.

unit.description: The unit of measurement of the characteristic.

AccountCharacteristic.description: Describes a given characteristic of an object or entity through a name/value/unit.

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency)

Money.description: A base / value business entity used to represent money

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity. SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.CUSTOMER_NODE_ID

href.description: Reference of the related entity - <http://<PEREST_HOSTNAME>:<PEREST_PORT>/<Customer PEREST URL>/<SV_MAPPING: ACCOUNT_TRE_V.CUSTOMER_NODE_ID>

name.description: Name of the related entity. SV_MAPPING: CUSTOMER_NODE_TRE_V.NODE_NAME

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation. SV_MAPPING: perestapi.REFERRED_TYPE->CUSTOMER RT

RelatedParty.description: Related Entity reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

offset.description: Requested index for start of items to be provided in response

limit.description: Requested number of items to be provided in response

remainingRecords.description: Remaining number of items to be fetched

totalRecords.description: Total number of items matching criteria

scn.description: Oracle system change number for read consistency

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class.

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name.

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)
